lazy-gm-prep.steps.review-characters.des: Refresh names, backgrounds, motivations, and player interests so the rest of your prep wraps around the PCs. Keep it short—this primes your brain for everything else.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.strong-start.title: 2. Create a Strong Start
lazy-gm-prep.steps.strong-start.descript: Define a vivid opening that drops the party near the action—an event, hook, or immediate scene that propels the session forward. When in doubt, start with conflict.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.outline-scenes.title: 3. Outline Potential Scenes
lazy-gm-prep.steps.outline-scenes.descri: Jot a loose list of likely scenes—just a few words each—to gain confidence without overcommitting. Be ready to throw them away when play goes elsewhere.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.secrets-clues.title: 4. Define Secrets & Clues
lazy-gm-prep.steps.secrets-clues.descrip: Write short, system‑agnostic facts the characters can discover anywhere during play. Aim for ~10.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.fantastic-locations.d: Name evocative places and list a few striking aspects (scale, age, weirdness). These become memorable backdrops you can drop in as needed.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.important-npcs.title: 6. Outline Important NPCs
lazy-gm-prep.steps.important-npcs.descri: List only the NPCs that drive the session. Give each a name, a role in the story, and a quick hook/archetype; improvise the rest at the table.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.choose-monsters.title: 7. Choose Relevant Monsters
lazy-gm-prep.steps.choose-monsters.descr: Pick foes that fit the situation and location. Treat difficulty as a loose gauge; let story and context shape the encounter. Prepare more for bosses as needed.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.magic-item-rewards.de: Plan an item or two that excites the players and ties into the story. Items can anchor secrets and become tangible hooks.
lazy-gm-prep.steps.other-notes.title: Other Notes
lazy-gm-prep.steps.other-notes.descripti: Scratch pad for reminders, marching order, pacing beats, or anything else you want at your fingertips.
